        Throws:

      • getMetaFile

        Searches the index for a metadata Document with "id" matching the passed id
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The metadata Document matching id or null if it does not exist

      • findName

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> findName(java.lang.String term,
                                        java.lang.String field,
                                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> constrainValues,
                                        java.lang.String constrainField,
                                        int maxResults,
                                        int set,
                                        int type)
        Searches for matches in a file's path and name

        For example, a search with the term "Foo" and the constrainValues {"/Bar", "/Stool"} will return files with a path related to "Foo" only from the directories or subdirectories or "/Bar" and "/Stool"

        Parameters:
        term - The search term for choosing and ranking results
        field - The field to search, i.e. "path"
        constrainValues - The paths to which to constrain the search
        constrainField - The field used to constrain searches
        maxResults - The maximum number of results that will be returned
        set - The set number, e.g., searching set 0 returns the first n results, searching set 1 returns the 2nd n results
        type - The type of the search, one of QUERY_BOOLEAN or QUERY_STANDARD
        Returns:
        A list containing all of the paths the searcher found, sorted by relevance

      • findInFiles

        public PageResult[] findInFiles(java.lang.String term,
                       java.lang.String field,
                       java.util.List<java.lang.String> constrainValues,
                       java.lang.String constrainField,
                       int maxResults,
                       int set,
                       int type)
        Searches for matches in the contents of multiple files

        For example, a search with the term "Foo" and the constrainValues {"/Bar", "/Stool"} will return pages with contents related to "Foo" only from the directories or subdirectories or "/Bar" and "/Stool"

        Parameters:
        term - The search term for choosing and ranking results
        field - The field to search, i.e. "contents"
        constrainValues - The paths to which to constrain the search
        constrainField - The field used to constrain searches
        maxResults - The maximum number of results that will be returned
        set - The set number, e.g., searching set 0 returns the first n results, searching set 1 returns the 2nd n results
        type - The type of the search, one of QUERY_BOOLEAN or QUERY_STANDARD
        Returns:
        A list of PageResult containing all of the results the searcher found, sorted by relevance

      • findInFile

        public PageResult[] findInFile(java.lang.String term,
                      java.lang.String field,
                      java.lang.String constrainValue,
                      java.lang.String constrainField,
                      int maxResults,
                      int set,
                      int type,
                      int page)
        Searches for matches in the contents of multiple files

        For example, a search with the term "Foo" and the constrainValue "/Bar.txt" will return pages with contents related to "Foo" only from inside the file "/Bar.txt"

        Parameters:
        term - The search term for choosing and ranking results
        field - The field to search, i.e. "contents"
        constrainValue - The path to which to constrain the search
        constrainField - The field used to constrain searches
        maxResults - The maximum number of results that will be returned
        set - The set number, e.g., searching set 0 returns the first n results, searching set 1 returns the 2nd n results
        type - The type of the search, one of QUERY_BOOLEAN or QUERY_STANDARD
        Returns:
        A list of PageResult containing all of the results the searcher found, sorted by relevance

      • getQuery

        private org.apache.lucene.search.Query getQuery(java.lang.String term,
                                      java.lang.String field,
                                      int type)
        Creates a query based on the given term field and type
        Parameters:
        term - Search Term for the query
        field - Document Field for the Query which the term is matched against
        type - The type of query to be created, either QUERY_BOOLEAN, or QUERY_STANDARD,
        Returns:
        a query for the given field and term using either a BooleanQuery with a WildcardQuery for the term or a Query built from a QueryParser and SimpleAnalyzer

      • getFilter

        private org.apache.lucene.search.Filter getFilter(java.lang.String constrainField,
                                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> constrainValues)
        Creates a directory filter
        Parameters:
        constrainField - The field that contains the directory info
        constrainValues - The directories to which the filters shold limit
        Returns:
        The created filter

      • getHighlightedResults

        private PageResult[] getHighlightedResults(java.util.List<org.apache.lucene.document.Document> docs,
                                 org.apache.lucene.search.Query qry,
                                 int type,
                                 java.lang.String term,
                                 int maxResults)
        Takes a list of Documents and highlights information relevant to a given Query
        Parameters:
        docs - The documents to highlight
        qry - The query used to highlight the documents
        type - The type of the search, one of QUERY_BOOLEAN, which just notes the page on which the term exists or QUERY_STANDARD, which gives highlighted fragments and the page on which they exist.
        term - The term that created the query
        maxResults - The maximum number of results that will be returned
        Returns:
        An array containing a PageResult entry for each result

      • getDocs

        private java.util.List<org.apache.lucene.document.Document> getDocs(int maxResults,
                                                          int set,
                                                          org.apache.lucene.search.ScoreDoc[] hits)
        Takes an array of ScoreDoc and turns it into the relevant number of Documents
        Parameters:
        maxResults - The maximum number of documents that will be parsed
        set - The set number, e.g., searching set 0 returns the first n results, searching set 1 returns the 2nd n results
        hits - The ScoreDoc to be parsed
        Returns:
        The list of documents that is maxResults long and skips set*maxResults results

      • getDocPaths

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String> getDocPaths(int maxResults,
                                           int set,
                                           org.apache.lucene.search.ScoreDoc[] hits)
        Takes an array of ScoreDoc and turns it into the relevant number of Document paths
        Parameters:
        maxResults - The maximum number of paths that will be parsed
        set - The set number, e.g., searching set 0 returns the first n results, searching set 1 returns the 2nd n results
        hits - The ScoreDoc to be parsed
        Returns:
        The list of paths that is maxResults long and skips set*maxResults results

      • interrupt

        public boolean interrupt()
        Calls for the any current searches to be inturrupted
        Returns:
        false if the interrupt flag was already set; otherwise true

        Returns:
